meanings.definition: To make someone or something late or slow
meanings.sent1: Heavy traffic delays the arrival of the bus.
meanings.sent2: The construction work delays the completion of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel delays the cat's nap by chattering loudly.
meanings.sent4: The storm delays the outdoor event like an unexpected guest disrupting a party.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog delays the sunrise, shrouding everything in mystery.

meanings.definition: A period of time when someone or something is made late or slow
meanings.sent1: The flight experienced delays due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: There was a long delay at the train station because of a signal issue.
meanings.sent3: The delay in the movie start time caused excitement among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the package delivery felt like time standing still.
meanings.sent5: The delay in the meeting made everyone restless, tapping their feet impatiently.
